comment: Honestly, this class drained me. I would recommend taking this class in person. during mid-semester till the end, she would forget to post the new assignments and wait till the last minute to post them on midweek and have them done by Sunday. She pushes a lot of things back. Her exams are lockdown browser/camera. 3 exams! 1 Proposal/Presentation!

This was a very interesting and easy 8-week class. Professor Pearcey assigned about one chapter to read a day, along with a quiz and assignment over 2-3 chapters every couple days. There were also four discussion posts. All quizzes were open note. Very easy A if you do the reading and all the work. I would take her again!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Been at KSU for more than 2yrs, so I know Pearcey isn't the worst prof, but I never got D on paper before her, with feedback "Overall good paper". If it was good, why D? No office hours. She replied to emails only during the semester,but doesn't reply or care for "outside" matters like recommendation letters. It shows she's robot,workshts pain hard

Pretty good professor and class for a Maymester. No quizzes or exams, just content check worksheets. I was concerned at first since the first few grades were low but overall a lenient grader. Just put effort into the worksheets and an A is easily attainable.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Accessible outside class--Online Savvy

comment: She was such an amazing professor! Loved her feedback and she really cares about your grades and wants you to pass. Please take her !!!!
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: Workload can be heavy, but Processor Pearcy will give you plenty of time to get the work done. Stay on top of the due dates, watch the tutorials and you will do fine. She's a really great professor.

This class has helped me further develop skills in research and statistics. If you did well in the prerequisites to this course, you are prepared. We did have SPSS assignments, and the video tutorials Dr. Pearcey gave were straightforward to understand and it helped a lot. I 10/10 would definitely recommend this course!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Gives good feedback

comment: Each module had 4 quizzes, 1 discussion, and an exam. Quizzes didn't use lockdown monitor, but exams did. You get multiple attempts on quizzes, but the exams look totally different. This class is very medical/science based, so if you just need an elective, I recommend taking something else thats a little easier. This should be a bio class instead.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: This professor is not organized & don't think anyone should take her bc of that. She changes the syllabus & expects us to understand them with little explanation. She'll post explanations but it's very confusing & we'll still wonder what needs to be done. Material isn't hard, but assignment instructions are often hard to understand.

Dot your T's and cross your I's when it comes to papers. She is a TOUGH grader. I either received an A or a C for assignments, never anything in between, I didn't feel like her grading was always fair. I don't plan to take her again.

As a veteran student, mom of 4, and attending college here and there over the last two decades I can already tell you: This professor is clear and comprehensive in what is to be expected for this course. Variety of assignments, you will learn, tells you what's needed to stay on track! One of the best I've had as online classes go in any subject.

I took this professor for Psychoneuro over the summer and it was my favorite class at KSU. she has consistent deadlines and she was able to understand and be flexible with deadlines. the lectures were very interesting and an easy grader.

I took this class this spring and do not care for math. There is lots of material and things you need to learn but Dr. Pearcey gave many extra credit opportunities that were not required. She is also very understandable as she pushed deadlines back on many occasions when many were unsuccessful and having technology problems. She does require spss.

I took Dr. Pearcey for psychoneuroimmunology for the maymester. Excellent teacher! You have to read 1-2 chapters a day (make sure you have time everyday) and fill out a worksheet while reading. There are discussion posts and open-note quizzes over the textbook/powerpoints/research. She emails back so quickly, and utilize office hours, shes so nice
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Get ready to read

comment: I would absolutely not recommend this professor. I took her cause she had a good rating. She was horrible. I failed all 3 tests, she didn't give any guidance on what to study. The only reason why I passed was cause of the weekly 5 assignments we had to do.

I took Professor Pearcey because of all the good comments on here, but I wish I had taken someone else honestly. I took her online PSYC 3000 course and she does not respond to emails and makes a lot of online errors (putting up assignments that aren't actually due, forgetting to make an assignment unlimited attempts when its supposed to be, etc.)

She does not baby you in this class by any means. She will help you if you ask for it. She's a tough grader because she checks for nuances and small slip-ups. You have to be detailed with your work, and make sure you triple check the assignments you submit. Other than that, she's an awesome professor that is genuinely amazing at her job.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--Tough grader

comment: She is such a sweet teacher. She did the best she could during Covid time and I respect that. The quizzes and proposal is a little hard but still manageable to get at least a B in the class.

This is not a hard class. But this teacher does not look at emails. I emailed her for the last 3 months about an assignment that I turned in that she put in a 0 for. I have constantly emailed her at least once a week and still no reply.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: Dr. Pearcey stepped in for my in-person class's professor and is probably one of the best professors I had this semester. There were many instances where I forgot to turn things in and she was extremely understanding and opened all of them back up for me. She's very responsive to emails and wants you to do well in her class.

There is typically a small assignment along with a bigger spss assignment every week. It is key to check out the assignments out as soon as they open and to email her early in the week with questions. She is very understanding, patient, and responsive. Some instructions just may not be clear but don't hesitate to email her because she will explain.

She takes forever to respond back to emails and sometimes she will completely forget to respond back. Lectures are super heavy and tests are even more hectic. Brain and behavior psych is 200 level class but she gives work like its a capstone. Good luck if you have her!!!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: I took her class online and this class was supposed to be hard but she made it sooooo easy! She really cares about how well her students are doing and will work with you to make sure you pass. I'm currently fighting to get into one of her other classes. She is seriously great! A true Gem

AMAZING! If you struggled in research methods or experimental take her! This was my 2nd time taking her & she is the best professor at kennesaw. Even though this class was 100% online she made herself available to meet with all the time she really wants you to make a good grade and pass her class. Gives a lot of opportunity to earn points.

Great professor, but expect to study and basically memorize the text. An A is possible, but you will have to read the text (I have prob 70 pgs of notes) and STUDY. I love physio, so it wasn't too bad but 50% of class Withdrew or failed. Def take her, though. Very sweet, understanding, and fun. I wish I'd have taken her sooner. No extra credit.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Test heavy--Clear grading criteria

comment: I took Dr. Pearcey for Physiological Psychology as a online course. This is the easiest online class i have ever taken! I think for those who struggle with biology/ anatomy it is best to take this class online. We are able to use our notes, powerpoints for the quizzes. the format of the class is easy to follow!
online physiological psychology was really easy. I would take again
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Test heavy--Clear grading criteria

comment: This professor is AWESOME. Experimental Design and Analysis is a difficult class, but she makes it bearable. I feel like I learned so much and my ability in statistics got better with her leading the way. The assignments are cake and she uses great examples, making it understandable. The tests can run a teeny bit long, but she gives ample time.
I took her for summer classes. She grades easily and is prompt in getting your grades back in time. The quizzes are easy and you get 3 attempts. No papers or group projects.

I cannot say enough good things about Dr. Pearcey. I have taken two of her online classes and they are great. Tests and quizzes are not hard if you read.  Put effort into discussion and article assignments and you get 100s. Physio is a hard class by nature but Dr. Pearcey makes  it less scary.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read

comment: Professor Pearcey is by far the BEST professor I have ever had! She makes any extremely difficult subject and makes it understandable and manageable. I would take any course she offered, despite if I needed it or not.

For an online class it was amazing how interactive this professor is, and if you don't understand a concept she is very accessible outside of class. This class is tough but as long as you read the chapters you will get an A. If you aren't good at teaching yourself or never have taken an onlyine class before I wouldn't recommend.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: It was really hard material. She made it enjoyable. She used youtube videos and assignments that made it stick. She gives a few assignments a week (multiple chances to retake quizes) , as long as you trully make an effort to understand and follow instruction , you'll get a decent grade and learn something
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: Dr. Pearcey is absolutely amazing. She came in to teach our Psyc of Religion class because our old professor resigned half way through. She had never read this book before, but was ready to hit the ground running after having 1 weekend to prepare. I don't know how she managed do do this, but she saved my semester. Take her!!

Dr. Pearcey is a great professor. She is very good at explaining difficult concepts and making them understandable. Her test can be challenging, but she always curves them and works with students. You need to read and go to class, it's applied chemistry so it's not exactly easy if you skip. Do the quizzes, go to class, you'll be A Okay.

Dr. Pearcey is so funny, relatable and approachable. I had her for a hybrid psychopharm class: 6 discussions, 9-10 online quizzes, 3 tests. The text helped a bunch. She talked about making the class easier in the future, but I thought it was appropriately challenging. PS, don't attempt before taking physio.
